fields.headline: WPP to reveal all at 7am
fields.bodyText: WPP is holding off until tomorrow morning to announce whether it has achieved the required 90% take-up of its offer for the media-buying group, Tempus. The company will issue an announcement at 7am tomorrow, in accordance with stock market regulations. If at least 90% of Tempus shareholders have accepted the 555p per share offer, WPP must go ahead with its acquisition of the company, despite the recent collapse in media share prices. Many of Tempus's biggest shareholders have already agreed to sell and analysts believe acceptances of WPP's offer will be high. Shares in both companies fell today amid the uncertainty, with Tempus now trading at 437.5p.
